title: GAP Index for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) Mortality
desc: The GAP Index for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) Mortality provides 1, 2, and 3-year mortality estimates for IPF patients.

orgreference.text: Ley B, Ryerson CJ, Vittinghoff E, Ryu JH, Tomassetti S, Lee JS, et al. A multidimensional index and staging system for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Ann Intern Med. 2012;156:684–91. doi: 10.7326/0003-4819-156-10-201205150-00004.

other_refer.text: Ley B, Bradford WZ, Weycker D, Vittinghoff E, du Bois RM, Collard HR. Unified baseline and longitudinal mortality prediction in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Eur Respir J. 2015;45:1374–81. doi: 10.1183/09031936.00146314

Wilkie MEM, Chalmers JD, Smith RP, Schembri S. Asthma outcomes: P134 Comparison of Two Prognostic Tools For Identifying High Risk Patients with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis. Thorax 2012;67:Suppl 2 A120 doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2012-202678.417

data.evidence:
Addition of assigned points.

The GAP Score stands for the “Gender, Age, and Physiology score.”

  • Gender and Age each have one associated criterion.
  • Physiology has two associated criteria (FVC and DLCO).
data.facts:
GAP staging for IPF:

Mortality
Points Stage 1-year 2-year* 3-year*
0-3 I 5.6% 10.9% 16.3%
4-5 II 16.2% 29.9% 42.1%
6-8 III 39.2% 62.1% 76.8%

*The GAP index is more sensitive, but less specific, than the the du Bois Score for predicting mortality.
